text: Aylmerton is a Northern Village of the Southern Highlands of New South Wales, Australia in Wingecarribee Shire. It is located north-east of Mittagong. The only buildings in Aylmerton are a fire station and houses, many of which are on farms. There is also an Aylmerton in Norfolk, England. == Transport == Aylmerton is positioned between the Hume Highway on its northwestern side and the Main South railway line on its southeastern side. They are the main road and rail routes between Sydney and Melbourne. A passenger railway station opened at Aylmerton in 1919 and closed in 1975.Aylmerton station, NSWrail.net, accessed 9 August 2009. == Industry == Near the demolished train station is a small industrial zone which is part of Braemar. It contains a few industrial complexes and a Bunnings Hardware Store. ==References== Category:Towns of the Southern Highlands (New South Wales) Category:Hume Highway Category:Main Southern railway line, New South Wales
title: Aylmerton, New South Wales
